intro: Zosima anethifolia, commonly known as the anise-leaved zosima, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, anise-scented leaves and small yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Zosima anethifolia is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to coastal environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
